newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SRI LANKA SELLS NAPHTHA TO MARUBENI AT -$1.42/BBL.
newsitem.headline: SRI LANKA SELLS NAPHTHA TO MARUBENI AT -$1.42/BBL.

text.p: Sri Lanka state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corp's (CPC) has awarded its sell tender for September naphtha to Japanese trader Marubeni Corp at $1.42 per barrel below Singapore spot quotes, free-on-board (fob) Colombo, a company official said on Thursday.
The tender which offered the 125,000-barrels of chemical naphtha with a 0.65-0.72 SG cargo on an fob basis from Colombo, closed August 13 and was valid for two days.
The cargo is lifting September 3-4 after CPC had brought forward the lay dates earlier this week following a cancellation of its middle-distillate tender which occupied the earlier berthing period.
The next best bids were from Dutch trader Vitol and Swiss trader Glencore, both at a discount of $1.77, he said.

Reflecting the fundamentally weak naphtha market, the discount for the current tender is nearly three times CPC's last naphtha award for July 18-19 cargo, to Dutch trader Vitol at 53 cents per barrel below Singapore spot quotes, fob.
